result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AS TO ALL COUNTS:  Restitution set at zero.
Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, cash bail on deposit shall apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments while on extended supervision, any amount remaining due and owing at the end of supervision is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to all counts and consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 73 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No association with known drug users or dealers,  and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
No contact with Co-defendant Elijah Gilmore.
No cash jobs.

AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent to all counts and consecutive to any other sentences with credit for 73 days.

***06-18-15/ Clare L Fiorenza***
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a prison sentence of 3 years and 6 months on Count 5, bifurcated into one year and 6 months of initial confinement and two years of Extended Supervision.  All other aspects of the sentence shall remain the same.
Concurrent with: Concurrent to all counts and consecutive to any other sentences with credit for 73 days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Case passed:
Case recalled:
Same appearances:
 
AS TO ALL COUNTS CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER:
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 4 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 73 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, cash bail on deposit shall apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments while on extended supervision, any amount remaining due and owing at the end of supervision is subject to  civil judgment and/or tax intercept.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 73 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, cash bail on deposit shall apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments while on extended supervision, any amount remaining due and owing at the end of supervision is subject to  civil judgment and/or tax intercept.

AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 73 days.
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay all mandatory costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, cash bail on deposit shall apply.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments while on extended supervision, any amount remaining due and owing at the end of supervision is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept.

AS TO ALL COUNTS:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and complay with any recommended treatment
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests. 
-Employment or school/no cash jobs
-No association with known durg users or dealers,  and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
-No contact with Co-defendant Elijah Gilmore

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Deliberations continue.  At the hour of 11:35 am, the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY TO ALL THREE COUNTS, which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 5/22/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court orders PSI.  PSI order, signed and filed.  aw

Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury in box: 2:27 pm.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:04 pm., to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Adam and Hill, who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury released for the night.  Jury out of box: 4:55 pm.  aw

Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court discusses potential witness testifying at trial, and possible violation of the sequestration order.  Parties and Witnesses sworn under oath as to the possible violation.  Court is precluding potential witness from testifying for reasons stated on the record.  Court also is not allowing additional items and information not coming in for trial with reasons stated on the record.  Court also denies defense motion to dismiss at the close of the State's case.  
Trial continued.  Jury in box:  10:20 am.  Sworn for defense: Milwaukee Police Officer, Paul Martinez; Defendant, Orlando Cotton.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box: 11:38 am.  aw

SECOND Amended Information, Received and filed.

Count 1:  Possession with intent to deliver cocaine- PTAC, as a party to a crime, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1m)(cm)1r, 939.50(3)(f), 939.05.  A class F felony.

Count 2:  Possession with intent to deliver controlled substance (THC), PTAC, as a party to a crime, contrary to WI Stats sec. 961.41(1m)(h)2, 939.50(3)(h), 939.05.  A class H felony.

Count 5:  Keeping a drug house, contrary to WI Stat sec. 961.42(1), 939.50(3)(i).   A class I felony.

Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Jury in box: 1:48 pm.  Trial continued.  Cross examination continues from Milwaukee Police Officer, Paul Martinez.  Sworn for the state:  State Crime Lab Antalyst, Laura Hedden.  Officer Martinez recalled.  Also sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Forensic Officer, Chet St Clair; Milwaukee Police Detective, James Henner.  Officer Paul Martinez.  Exhibits 1-42, 43-50, 53, 59-81, 85, and 200 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box: 4:27 pm.  Discussions made about information not coming in for trial.  aw

Defendant Orlando Lloyd Cotton in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Second Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty to all 3 counts. 

Jury in box: 9:16 am.  Trial continued.  Cross examination continues from Milwaukee Police Officer, Paul Martinez.  Exhibit 200 received.  Jury released for lunch.  Jury out of box: 12:02 pm.  aw
